description: Says "An update is available." The only button present is a "Back" button! There is no "Install update" option. Pressing "Update help" only lets you change from automatic (which doesn't work) to manual updating (there are no instructions on how to do this).
summary: Says update is available but cannot install it

description:
It's useful to have an antivirus scanner. If you have to prepare a set of files to send to someone or for people to download this means you are less likely to have the embarassment of sending out a virus and at least if you do you'll be able to answer the question "did you scan it" with "yes, the scanner must have missed it".

ClamAV has had reasonable reviews in the past. It's better than some commercial AV, but maybe not at the level you really want if you are expecting to be protected by AV. 

The user interface is okay but
* make sure you turn on recursive scanning of directories
* wait for some time when starting checks - the interface freezes for a little while and Ubuntu sometimes wants to kill it - after a while it recovers
summary: useful - bit limited - some user interface limitations

description:
Okay, so the interface is pretty questionable as far as antiviruses I've used go, mainly because it's tough to figure out how to scan anything and most of the things that'll come up anyways are false positives or viruses that only infect Windows systems. Though I'm sure it'll be more useful when the time comes for more viruses to target the Linux OS.

So, as for how you use the darn thing, you need to update its virus directory by hitting the "update button" and letting it just run from there. Afterwards, if you're looking to scan your entire system, you need to click "Scan a Directory" then click "File System" and let it scan your files.

The "Whitelist", Scheduler, and Update Assistant don't really work as far as I've been able to see, so everything has to be done manually.

So, is it worth downloading? It can be if you're curious or just that paranoid about what's lurking in your system. Does it work? Yes, but only if you know how to use it properly. Personally, I'm keeping this on my system just because it's the only working antivirus I am able to find on Linux, but you should be fine without it so long as you're careful surfing the web.
summary: It's alright, though not entirely necessary for Linux systems

description: Though this is supposed to be a GUI, it uh... does not appear to open? I'm not sure if I'm missing something.

ClamTK seems to find components within apps and software that are normal and neccesary components and flag them as either possible viruses or dangerous in some manner. Given that there is an option to delete these based on Clam's reccomendation, it makes Clam TK dangerous in the hands of someone who doesn't know better

Linux can easily get viruses, worms, and trojans, especially if Wine is installed. In fact, due to the lack of sandboxing on X11, Linux might even be more vulnerable. So a malware scanner is necessary, and it just so happens that this one is free in all senses of the world. Just install it.
summary: It's a must-have. Don't listen to the reviews about packaging errors

I have used this for years to clean hard drive that I mount and scan for clients' MS Windoze systems that have a re-infecting malware issues. that it is not really needed for Linux is starting to change, but for now is (knock on wood) mostly true so novices to Linux might skip this one. My preference is to install and use it to check shareable media or friends/clients infected MS system disks. it does require a little RTFM which for better use of any Linux distro is a good policy to get better use.

one thing to remember about anti-virus and malware is in order to work the model is the first 100,000 fall and then forensics can find a counter'. While some companies to protect Windoze systems try to look for suspicious behavior even that is a reactive approach. Most current issues tend to be mistaken invited downloads by operator just like infamous "This is Microsoft Security calling..." scams where the victim allows remote entry into the system.
summary: Great for deep clean your clients Windoze media

Also, you can set the software to update automatically but like the comments below mention this never appears to happen and the "Update available" text is seen throughout the GUI.
I think its an okay program, the only reason this is probably useless to me is because with hackers, linux for desktops is an unpopular system, except linux servers, common for hell and beyond.

Al actualizar desde la de la cara de gorila hacia la versión GNU/Linux Ubuntu 21.04 (la de la cara de hipopótamo, en el escritorio), han dejado de funcionar ClamTk, nada hacía, no abría la ventana para analizar. Acá debajo Rossana comparte este enlace:  https://gitlab.com/dave_m/clamtk/-/wikis/Downloads Luego seleccionado el sistema operativo Linux se descargó este: clamtk_6.11-1_all.deb En el disco duro, seleccionarlo, botón derecho, elegir "Abrir con instalarsoftware"; se abre la ventana de snap de ClamTk, click en instalar; listo, ClamTk volvió a funcionar. El análisis es a petición del usuario ya que no reside en la memoria RAM, no es automático. Da mucha tranquilidad. Gracias a los desarrolladores de ClamTk. Me gustaría que pusieran en el snap a ClamAv, también.
summary: Para quienes han actualizado a la versión GNU/Linux Ubuntu 21.04

Tengo Ubuntu 20.04. Esta version 6.14 de Clam Tk es de hace 3 o 4 meses. Ir a su web puede ser parte de tu solución. Un saludo.

Lo he instalado desde hace muchas versiones atrás, pero subsisten los mismos problemas. Indica que hay una actualización disponible pero no ofrece una forma de ejecutar el actualizador. Entonces, si uno analiza un archivo no sabe si podría estar infectado porque la base de datos no está actualizada.
No me queda claro si funciona o no.

J'ai installé Kubuntu il y a quelques jours, donc pas grand chose à analyser. J'ai lancé ClamTk en soirée, après deux heures d'analyse non terminée je me suis couché; le lendemain il tournait toujours (alors je l'ai stoppé), il avait trouvé 86 dangers potentiels et c'étaient des fichiers macro de libreOffice (jamais utilisé) !!

SE: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS 64 bits

Permet de lancer une analyse antivirus de son système et de ses fichiers, très pratique.

Les fichiers macros sont marqués comme potentiellement dangereux et c'est tout à fiat normal.
En effet il est possible d'écrire un virus informatique en macro, le logiciel antivirus va donc systématiquement les détecter dans le doute.
À l'utilisateur de faire ensuite attention à la légitimité de ces fichiers (origine, type d’exécution, contenu...).

Ставте весь Clam и AV и TK с официальных сайтов и будет всем счастье. Всё будет работать, а здесь просто какой-то баг.
Программа неплохая. Доработают и здесь, но вот когда - это вопрос.)

В принципе неплохая программа для обнаружения угроз. У меня не одной угрозы не нашла программа. Плохо что сразу не сканирует весь компьютер или диск, приходится сканировать по одной папке или файлу это неудобно.

env LC_TIME=C clamtk из терминала. можно прилепить к клавише напр. F10. Теперь в конце проверки появится окно с результатом кот. даже фиксируются. В настройках галку на потенциальные угрозы не ставить ибо "Лис" уже есть угроза, и не только он. Ставить лучше из Синаптика.
